summary: John Oldman, now 14,000 years old and teaching in Northern California, realizes that not only is he finally starting to age, but four students have discovered his deepest secret.

reviews.content: I enjoyed this film almost as much as the first one. Really hoping they do a third to answer some questions they left unanswered at the end.
loved every minute of both of them, tried to donate but the payment systems are not working on the website. Please make more!
loved every minute of both of them, tried to donate but the payment systems are not working on the website. Please make more!
loved every minute of both of them, tried to donate but the payment systems are not working on the website. Please make more!
loved every minute of both of them, tried to donate but the payment systems are not working on the website. Please make more!
loved every minute of both of them, tried to donate but the payment systems are not working on the website. Please make more!

God, this was never supposed to be. Horrible performances, almost ruined it for me. Could have been enacted a bit better in my opinion. Much better, if I had to hope. The first movie was a godsend. I still watch it from time to time, makes me think of sci-fi as the philosophical and conceptual genre that it is. What I loved most about the first movie, the simplicity with the small cast, singular location and perfectly eloquent dialogic narrative was lost here. I absolutely refuse to believe it's in any way related to the cinematic masterpiece that was the 2007 original. Please don't watch, it'll ruin your thoughts about the first movie as well. Loved the original, wish the sequel never happened. No more. Never again.

Enjoyed a good film. It was at first hard to get into the movie. I didn't understand any part of it at first. 

After watching it, I grew into the film and liked it. I'm not a big fan of science fiction. I am however a fan of gentle classics.

Horrible attempt to make a buck. With no creativity, no fresh ideas, nothing but a shameless bag of boring tricks.
From open endings to characters, plot and even the essence of the previous movie, to directly begging for the money at the begging and ending of the movie
It's a very sad thing to see. The director/writer openly admitting he could turn the original movie into anything ( even into a serial killer horror film !!! ) just to make some money.
Horrible
Terrible made for TV movie at best. The ending does not make any sense. Completely ruins the message of the first movie.

I'm sorry that I didn't know there was a second part until now.  I had told a lot of people about it, but just brought it up to my son this year and stumbled on part two.  I didn't even know about contributing, but I will today.  I so hope that this story continues.  It is so mind opening and original compared to other movies these days.  Please do more and try to advertise more.  Peace, Jim  P.S.  Great acting by David Lee Smith and the whole crew.

Nobody expected some as brilliant as the first piece.
But the ending really was a massive turn-off.

Serial killer, really? Really? Wtf is wrong with you turning this masterpiece into horseshit? Shame on you!

The original film was much better.  Not as a film, but as a thought exercise.  Here, they retain some of the intellectual exercise, but jettison much of the brains of the movie in favor of a Scooby Doo mystery.  He would have gotten away with it if it wasn't for those darn kids!  Worst of all, they just end the movie, mid plot.  Like they are going to make a sequel - which, let me tell you, few would watch at this point.  They literally left 3 or 4 major plot points dangling.  And this one really ramps up the anti-Christianity that the first flick only hinted at.
I loved this movie..  slow paced, lots to think about.
Whaaaaat!!!! hold my beer
Not as well done or as intellectual as the first one, but still a solid movie. Please make a third!
1st one made your think that he was 14k yrs old. This one was more like a scooby doo mystery.
High hopes.  Somewhat disappointed.  Wish it hadn't taken the turn at the end.  Not the spirit of the first movie.  Tough to please all folks but glad it finally got made.
It's hard to objectively critique this compared to the original that this is a sequel to.  It's everything bad that the original wasn't.  Not worth bothering to watch.

The synopsis for the movie is interesting the film itself is awful. Awful directing, acting, the whole film feels like it amateur production. There’s really no resolution or explanation of the film and it drags on and on. A Sci-fi snoozer.

The synopsis for the movie is interesting the film itself is awful. Awful directing, acting, the whole film feels like it amateur production. There’s really no resolution or explanation of the film and it drags on and on. A Sci-fi snoozer.

It's bad. It's really bad. Poor taste in writing and acting. Stay with the first movie that was quirky but captivating. This way is just filled with cliches and non sense. 
If you want an example of a bad movie, go for it. It has potential to become a B movie classic.

Technically superior to the first film but MUCH MORE POORLY WRITTEN AND DIRECTED. Ugh. I watched both out of intellectual curiosity in the production values. There was a scene here early on that I felt was VERY poorly directed. Overall the acting may be better than the first film but the writing is Much, much worse and that makes it even more of a disappointment. Still, I'm rating it higher.
Not as good as the original, but still fascinating and thought-provoking
Absolutely terrible.

The movie is very entertaining and thought provoking. Witnessing the beliefs of others clash against the spoken truth of another lays bear the significant emotional events of when reality and belief collide.
Loved it as much as the original.

Total garbage.

This is just another movie, in a long line of movies, denigrating organized religion.

Summary: Everything in the Bible, Quran, Buddhism is a lie because these folks said so.
Crapped all over the original. God what a horrid film.

Watched the fist one in 2008 just by random downloading. Now there is 2nd after 10 years.
How to make the plot after 10 years that John would really get old? 
There is hints that effects from air, food, water and so on would kill.

Just watched it once. Many locations, all appropriate and interesting. Great acting, though more dramatic than the first Man from Earth film and too dramatic than my ideal movie. The plot pacing was really good - didn't linger too long in one scene and almost all scenes had plot purpose. Variety of characters, whose development didn't require much character focus and were instead created by a character-adding line every so often. The sound was great - background-only and defined the mood and plot pacing quite well. My only small criticism is about the heavy christ focus of this one - I'm just not a fan of youthful devout religious characters. A film-maker has to choose a plot, though, and it was a fair handling of this plot type. A well-made movie! The first Man from Earth film introduced a wild new idea, and it's impossible to continue that story while opening up another wild new idea. Well-handled indeed!
I have waited a very long time for this!! I was in no way disappointed. If you take the goals of the makers into account then this new film fits the bill perfectly as a feature length pilot.

Having loved the original, I was looking forward to the sequel and I really liked it.
It is fast paced and touches aspects which were important in making the first film a cult classic. Though not at the same level as the original (I think it would have been extremely difficult to top that - and which sequel does anyways), I felt this film retains the soul of the original and was quite fun to watch.
a very impressive follow up to the original

Not very good.  The first instalment was excellent, a really captivating movie that made me want to re-watch it several times and tell my friends about it.  Holocene doesn't do it - I really struggled to watch it all the way through and was left wondering 'what was the point?'
Not as intimate as the first film but good all the same.

La suite d'un excellent film de SF, minimaliste et intelligent. Holocene est distribué gratuitement (avec encouragement au don), c'est assez notable. J'ai personnellement beaucoup aimé le premier, et suivi l'intrigue du second volet avec intérêt. La fin ouverte donne envie d'une nouvelle suite pour avoir les réponses manquantes... Bref, si comme moi le thème de l'immortalité vous tente, foncez !
a good follow up to a great movie. This is worth watching if you enjoyed the first movie.
La continuación lógica a Man from Earth, al final debía encontrarse en esta situación

The movie did not live up to the expectations based on the 1st Part. The focal point was tangentially disoriented to prove something by wannabe teenagers, no real debate, no content. Bringing old characters like Art and Harry was diametrically opposite to the central theme of John moving across multitude of ages/time/people and civilizations. It's a gold plating attempt instead of gold creation attempt!!!
I love this movie it is a awesome and a terrific movie

The logical next step following its' spectacular predecessor. While it does not live up to the excellence of the first film (an impossible bar set so high), it has some wonderful elements and more than anything, left we wanting to see a third installment. That is the true measure of a successful sequel.
Awesome movie .. provides closure to the legendry story of John oldman
Love this movie. Great follow up. Please make more

Thought provoking movie if seen from a philosophical perspective. Many people perceive it as a normal movie and will mention plot holes and not enough explanation. However, movies in this genre are left to the viewers to make their own opinion and those deficiencies are not seen as such because they are left at the viewer disposal to make an independent and unbiased guess of what it could be. Philosophical films can be judged by an ordinary critic because they might not be able to get to the essence of it. Brilliant ! Made me think in a long time after Terrence Mallick Movies
I would have liked if there was less thrill and more depth into his experience like in the first movie. Anyway, worth the time.
Really cool... but need more : a serie, why not ? Something changes, our time, our civilization, and if a serie could be a mirror of our society, it will be great !!

There is a lot less left for the cryptic belief here but the story thread is still intriguing.. loved the first one but this one is definitely worth the watch. As lways, it makes you want to ponder and invokes long coffee discussions on the plot
This is a perfect set up for a trilogy. Great job.
Amazing movie, well directed and William Katt does an amazing job as always. Loved it

A movie that's made to make you think about right and wrong more so than religion or not. A thought provoking movie that could be explained by science or theology - they keep you guessing till the end.

iT WAS...not very good.. As you can see from the other reviews, it was not like, and was not as good as the first one. It lacked a lot of the depth. I thought the acting was fine, and as an indy film, it did a lot with the resources it had. But it won't be loved, and likely won't be remembered in the coming years, like the original will be. If they do manage to make more, i'll probably watch them, but without any sense of anticipation.

The first movie was better. This ONE....several notable stars who gabe good perormances. filming and sound was amateur.  
They are setting it up for a epic showdown between good and evil.  Better filming,  better directing and this series would have been mainstream, red carpet, hot high grossing films.
Nice try at a logical extension of the original (that I loved), but didn't cover anything interesting for me.

Between 3 and 3.5 stars. It was very difficult to make such a good film as the first one and, of course, they did not get it. However, they continued the debate from the first movie through new questions, involved a new generation (which did not display very high standards) and justified some changes in an intelligent way. They did not add much to what we knew about the character but, and the end, but has opened a new way that can be useful for a quite different approach of the original idea, but which can be valid too. For me, they can continue trying.

I remember being really impressed by the first movie; it was smart and original however I still don't think that it needed a sequel. I'm not very fond of the cast as well. I'm not watching a third one.

Nothing will ever come as good as the first, that's said, the movie didn't live to my expectations and except for couple of good scenes the rest was very disappointing but it states an important issue about our messed up humanity. 

Unfortunately, it doesn't spend enough time on the ideas and debate that made the original film so captivating for audiences who discovered it.

Not just because the ending was left open, but the insinuation of 'violence from someone who died a while back'....didn't quite understand where that was going. Wasn't bad I suppose. I like the way it got you thinking...and the way civilization is destroying life. Acting could have been better, Brittany Curran's character didn't do her any favours.
Saw it. Good indy. Maybe story is attempt at serious look at Encino Man. A little  heavy on philosophy, but well acted. Gave to cause.

Plot was basic and contrived, with the new cast of characters being shallow and one dimensional. The post credits setup for a squeal of some sort also seemed forced and disconnected from the first film thematically. 

On a positive note, the final scene of the film pre-credits was very well done, and would happily fit in with the first film. The rest sadly did not live up to expectations.
Terrible sequel to a brilliant film.

A good follow-up to the original that was made in 2007.  Again, the acting could be improved, but not likely that much because it's still a low budget movie.  The storyline is again very unique and interesting from beginning to end.  The main reason I only rate this 3* is because the ending leaves something to be desired.

The movie had a large amount of very interesting points  to start with. A group of young students, one of them is a absolute christian. It should have extend the religion question with such a group, but instead the movie just aim to be a thriller withouth any more content that could add more to the original material from the first Man from earth. At the end, it feels like the movie miss a good 30 minutes, and the milling of the producer to maybe make a third movie or a serie afraid me. The first movie didn't need or deserve a sequel, it was perfect like that. Please limit the damage.

Great film. Not quite as good as the first one in my opinion but I think it was going for different goals than the first one. In "Man from Earth" the movie was really toying with the concept of an immortal while in "Holocene" the main point seemed to be a leaping off junction for a television series or something similar.
